context: n-decanem−3 at the beginning of ventilation and then decreased with time during the study. Hexane and cyclohexane attained peak concentration of 64.63 and 53.92μgm−3 at 6th day and then decreased. Methyl-cyclohexane was measured in relatively low concentrations of no higher than 3.87μgm−3 during the entire composting process. MSWs biostabilization process emitted relatively high concentrations of toluene, ethylbenzene, xylene, ethyltoluene, at the range of 73.84–728.23μgtoluenem−3, 1190.67–4587.43μgethylbenzenem−3, 1973.25–8099.69μgxylenem−3 and 84.58–917.22μgethyltoluenem−3,

llm_generation.summary: In this context, ethylbenzene and toluene are both mentioned as volatile organic compounds (VOCs) emitted during the biostabilization process of municipal solid waste (MSW). The study reports their concentration ranges, indicating that both compounds are significant components of the emissions. However, there is no detailed discussion of their specific interactions or comparative significance beyond their presence in the same emission profile.
